description:
Historical connections
Admiral Fitzroy sailed to Galapagos Islands with Charles Darwin.
Grave within Church grounds.
Famous artist Camille Pissarro painted local scenes one of All Saints Church.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs:
Built in 1827-1829  Parish of Norwood takes its name from the Great North Wood.
Original Chapel was a rectangular building with galleries and box pews seating 800.
The tower and spire were added in 1841,the chancel and Lady chapel in 1861.
Charles Dickens mentioned All Saints Church in his novel David Copperfield,
Vice Admiral Fitzroy whose grave is situated in All Saints Churchyard sailed with Charles Darwin to the Galapagos Islands.

location.address: All Saints Church, Church Road, SE19 3EP
travel_info: Train: West Norwood, Norwood Junction, Crystal Palace

name: All Saints Church
